dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4204 IH: Medicare Patient Choice Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Smucker (for himself and Mr. Davis of North Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to allow Medicare beneficiaries to choose their physical and occupational therapists, speech-language pathologists, audiologists, and chiropractors.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicare Patient Choice Act.

section.header: Free choice of therapists for Medicare beneficiaries
section.text: Section 1802(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395a(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and
in subparagraph (B), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in clause (i), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in clause (v), by striking physicians or practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, or qualified audiologists; and
in the matter following clause (v), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in the heading, by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in subparagraph (A), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking physician or practitioner each place it appears and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and
in clause (ii), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in clause (i), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and
in clause (ii), by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking physician or practitioner each place it appears and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist;
in the heading, by striking physicians and practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, and qualified audiologists;
in subparagraph (A), by striking physicians and practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, and qualified audiologists; and

clause.text: in the manner preceding clause (i), by striking physicians and practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, and qualified audiologists;
in clause (iv), by striking physicians and practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, and qualified audiologists; and
in clause (v), by striking physicians and practitioners and inserting physicians, practitioners, therapists, and qualified audiologists; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking paragraphs (1), (2), (3), and (4) of;

clause.text: in the heading, by striking physician or practitioner and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and
by striking physician or practitioner each place it appears and inserting physician, practitioner, therapist, or qualified audiologist; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

The term therapist means a qualified physical therapist (as such term is used in section 1861(p)), a qualified occupational therapist (as such term is used in 1861(g)), or a qualified speech-language pathologist (as defined in 1861(ll)(4)(A)).
The term qualified audiologist has the meaning given such term in section 1861(ll)(4)(B).
